column7: The second of four sequential courses in the undergraduate music theory core. Explores fundamental tonal theory, including terminology, notation, analysis of musical elements, procedures and forms. Specific skills learned include melodic analysis, species counterpoint, first and second level tonal analysis, part writing, phrase structure and analysis, composition, harmonization of given melodies, and keyboarding. Credit is not given for both MUS 102 and MUS 104. Prerequisite: MUS 101 or placement by examination.
column9: Credit is not given for both MUS 102 and MUS 104. Prerequisite: MUS 101 or placement by examination.
column11: Students must register for the lecture and one discussion section.
